title: Convert Sorted Array to Binary Search Tree
description: Given an integer array nums where the elements are sorted in ascending order, convert it to a height-balanced binary search tree.   Example 1: Input: nums = [-10,-3,0,5,9] Output: [0,-3,9,-10,null,5] Explanation: [0,-10,5,null,-3,null,9] is also accepted: Example 2: Input: nums = [1,3] Output: [3,1] Explanation: [1,null,3] and [3,1] are both height-balanced BSTs.   Constraints: 1 <= nums.length <= 104 -104 <= nums[i] <= 104 nums is sorted in a strictly increasing order.
examples: Input: nums = [-10,-3,0,5,9] Output: [0,-3,9,-10,null,5] Explanation: [0,-10,5,null,-3,null,9] is also accepted:
Input: nums = [1,3] Output: [3,1] Explanation: [1,null,3] and [3,1] are both height-balanced BSTs.
